direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the standard Java object contract and are often tested together due to their interdependence.
Both methods provide insights into the object's state, and testing one can indirectly enhance the other.
The equals method relies on the state of changed elements, making it dependent on the getChangedElements method.
The equals method indirectly depends on the core change status, which is determined by the isCoreChanged method.
The equals method in the ChangedOperation class serves the same purpose and can be tested similarly.
The equals method in the ChangedSchema class serves the same purpose and can be tested similarly.
The equals method in the ChangedExtensions class serves the same purpose and can be tested similarly.
